original: Bovik, Alfred Teodor, vicekonsul, Lysekil, f. 23/7/72 i Lysekil av Olaus B. o. Elisabeth Nicklasson. — Egen rör. i Lysekil 92-05, konservmäst. o. disp. i Riga 96-00, i komp :skap m. en broder, Otto Bovik, 06, ombild. firman t. A-B 25. Danm. v. konsul sed. 23, Fd. led. av stadsfullm., drätselkamm. (18 år) o. hälsov:nd, en av stift, av o. fd. verkst. dir. f. Lysekils Pilsner-dricksutskänkn. A-B, init:tag. t. Kon-servfabr. fören. (nu Sv. konservfabr. riksfören.), stift, av o. fd. ordf. i Lysekils segelsällsk. m. m. Res. t. USA 20, Island 19-21, Engl. 21, Tyskl., Ital. o. Frankr. 23-38. Hobbies : segl., motorsport. RVO, RDDO, RIFO.
translated: Bovik, Alfred Teodor, vice consul, Lysekil, born July 23, 1872 in Lysekil to Olaus B. and Elisabeth Nicklasson. Owned a business in Lysekil from 1892-1905, was a master and distributor of canned goods in Riga from 1896-1900, established a company with his brother, Otto Bovik, in 1906, and restructured the firm to a corporation in 1925. He was appointed a consul to Denmark in 1923, a former member of the city council, finance committee (18 years), and health committee, as well as a founding member of Lysekils Pilsner-drinking committee. He initiated the conservation factory organization (now known as the Swedish conservation factory nationwide association) and was a former chairman of Lysekils Sailing Society, among other things. He traveled to the USA in 1920, Iceland from 1919-1921, England in 1921, Germany, Italy, and France from 1923-1938. His hobbies included sailing and motorsports. He was awarded RVO, RDDO, RIFO.

occupation.name: Master and distributor of canned goods

foundingMember.name: Conservation factory organization
foundingMember.startDate: now known as the Swedish conservation factory nationwide association
